_header: Sith time that all this world was wrought
Note: For miracles performed at Hailes Abbey, see 541.
Title(s): The Legend of the Blood of Hayles
Subjects: Hailes (Gloucs.), Cistercian abbey; miracles; legends, of Jesus and Mary
_description: The Legend of the Blood of Hayles — l00 quatrains

BLRoy17Cxvii.First Lines:
[s]En tyme þat alle þis warde was wroughtMany marwykkes
                        yaf[?] bene falleþe wylk if þai were all throgh
                    soghtþe pepull wylde not lewe þam alle…
BLRoy17Cxvii.Last Lines:
þus endys þe story wyt outyn fayleOf Eryll Edmunde
                    þat knyght so godeHow he broght to þe abbay of hayleþe
                    swete & þe holy precyous blode
BLRoy17Cxvii.Note:
At the end of the second line, ‘af’ is inserted in the
                    margin, but the directions for insertion into the text are faded.
BLRoy17Cxvii.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 275-81.
Duff,  Edward Gordon. 
             “The Library of Richard Smith.” 
             The Library
         n.s. 8 (1907): 127-33: 127.
